TITLE: Running PHPUnit Tests in Matecat
DESCRIPTION: Commands for executing the full PHPUnit test suite or specific test cases. The first command runs all tests, while the second allows filtering for specific test cases using the --filter parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/matecat/matecat/blob/develop/tests/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
vendor/bin/phpunit --filter=[test_name_here]

TITLE: Validating JSON using JSONValidator in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the JSONValidator component to validate JSON against a schema. The validator is built on top of Swagger PHP and can check if a JSON is valid or return an array of validation errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/matecat/matecat/blob/develop/lib/Model/QAModelTemplate/readme.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
$jsonSchema = file_get_contents( '/path/to/your/schema.json');
$jsonToBeValidated = file_get_contents('path/to/your/json.json');

$validator = new \Validator\JSONValidator($jsonSchema);

$validator->isValid($jsonToBeValidated); // return boolean
$validator->validate($invalidFile);      // return an array of errors
```

TITLE: Configuring Apache VirtualHost for MateCat
DESCRIPTION: This Apache configuration sets up a VirtualHost for MateCat, including directory permissions, expiration rules, and logging settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/matecat/matecat/blob/develop/INSTALL/INSTALL.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: apache
CODE:
```
<VirtualHost @your_ip_address@:@port@>
    ServerName matecat.@your domain@
    ServerAdmin webmaster@translated.net
    DocumentRoot @full/path/to/matecat/source/files@
    DirectoryIndex index.php index.php3 index.html index.htm index.shtml
    <Directory @full/path/to/matecat/source/files/@>
        Options All
        AllowOverride All
        Order allow,deny
        allow from all

        ExpiresActive On
        ExpiresByType text/html "access plus 1 hour"
        ExpiresByType text/css "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType text/javascript "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType image/gif "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType image/jpeg "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType image/jpg "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType image/png "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType image/vnd.microsoft.icon "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType image/ico "access plus 1 week"
        ExpiresByType application/x-shockwave-flash "access plus 1 week"
    </Directory>
    php_flag register_globals off
    php_flag magic_quotes_gpc off
    LogLevel error
    ErrorLog /var/log/apache2/matecat.error.log
    CustomLog /var/log/apache2/matecat.log combined
    ServerSignature Off
</VirtualHost>
```

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access Restrictions for Matecat Application
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt file defines access rules for web crawlers, preventing them from indexing or accessing specific sections of the Matecat application. It uses the User-agent and Disallow directives to specify which paths should not be crawled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/matecat/matecat/blob/develop/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow: /translate/
Disallow: /revise/
Disallow: /manage/
Disallow: /analyze/
Disallow: /jobanalysis/
Disallow: /editlog/
Disallow: /revise-summary/
```

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access Control in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: Standard robots.txt configuration that blocks all web crawlers from accessing any part of the website. Uses the wildcard User-agent (*) to target all crawlers and the root Disallow directive (/) to prevent access to all paths.

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:

```
